meanings.definition: A person who adds pepper to food.
meanings.sent1: The pepperers at the restaurant always make sure to have freshly ground pepper available.
meanings.sent2: The group of pepperers in the kitchen were busy seasoning the dishes for the evening rush.
meanings.sent3: The pepperers had a pepper-themed party where everything from drinks to desserts had a hint of pepper.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the pepperer of the family, adding just the right amount of spice to every meal.
meanings.sent5: The pepperers' secret to delicious dishes was their skillful use of different types of pepper.

meanings.definition: Plural form of pepperer, referring to multiple individuals who add pepper to food.
meanings.sent1: During the cooking competition, the pepperers worked together to create a perfectly seasoned dish.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant hired new pepperers to meet the increasing demand for peppered dishes.
meanings.sent3: The pepperers formed a club where they shared pepper recipes and cooking tips.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling kitchen, the pepperers' synchronized movements ensured every dish was perfectly seasoned.
meanings.sent5: The group of pepperers became known for their ability to elevate any dish with their pepper expertise.
